content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #71104 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
this issue is blocking intra-docs for a week and there is no clear path on how to proceed with it, so some compiler :eyes: would be useful
Well, I have a path. I'm just not sure it's a very good one :laughing: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/73566
I think we can I-nominated it
That’s the best way to have T-compiler folks looking at it imo
But that means that we’d have to wait until Thursday
I was tempted, but i thought better to get opinion first
that should be fine (that was the intention)
In the meantime I think we can prioritize it to P-high or even P-critical as a "potential release blocker"?
Note that a fair amount of rustdoc people have already looked at the PR so the question is more 'is this a reasonable tradeoff to make' than 'is there a solution that exists'
Let’s nominate it already

@WG-prioritization/alerts #71104 has been nominated for discussion in T-compiler meeting.

Procedure

  • Already discussed?
  • Worth the meeting time?
  • Add agenda entry:
    • Why nominated?
    • Assignee?
    • Issue? PR? What's the status?
    • Summary and important details?
Hmm, that message isn’t supposed to pop up here
Anyway, what do you think about the priority of this?
I think it's P-high, @Manish Goregaokar will probably think P-critical (they really want to get intra-doc links out :laughing: )

but yes this is definitely a blocker for intra-doc links, I don't even know if it's possible to make them work without since you need to know the parent module of the item and there's no way to do that without climbing the DefId tree
oops sorry that wasn't addressed to me
No, any opinion is welcome! :slight_smile:
And you probably know this issue better than me or DPC
i'm going with p-high on this.
Issue #71104's prioritization request has been removed.

Agenda entry:

  • Blocks a rustdoc feature: intra-doc links.
  • Has no clear path for a fix, thus would benefit from discussion in a T-compiler meeting.
  • Unassigned
  • Issue raised when trying to remove DUMMY_HIR_ID
  • has a proposed fix by Joshua Nelson: #73566
wait duh this was nominated, do we still p-* it?
I believe we should
Though this isn’t technically an issue, this is a blocker for other features so I think we should keep track of it
That’s only my opinion though
